title: Janes Island State Park rangers offer ways to hike out of 2024 or hike into 2025
text:
CRISFIELD — Rangers at Janes Island State Park offer an opportunities to hike your way out of 2024 or to welcome 2025 with last day and first day hikes next week.
A Ranger-led “Last …
CRISFIELD — Rangers at Janes Island State Park offer an opportunities to hike your way out of 2024 or to welcome 2025 with last day and first day hikes next week.
A Ranger-led “Last Day Birding Hike” will be held at Irish Grove Sanctuary on New Year’s Eve. At 2,300 acres along Pocomoke Sound it’s the largest nature preserve owned by the Maryland Ornithological Society.
Located on Rumbly Point Road near Marion, the hike will be two miles. Meet at Janes Island State Park at 10 a.m. in the camper check-in parking lot and participants will caravan to Irish Grove.
On New Year’s Day sleep in this year as the Ranger-led hike will not be in the morning but a sunset hike starting at 4 p.m. starting at the Janes Island State Park Nature Center.
Participants may want to bring a flashlight for the one-mile walk through the Whitetail Trail that ends along the Daughtery Creek Canal in time for sunset.
This marks 10 years since First Day Hikes have been held at Janes Island, and pre-registration for either hike is not required. Leashed pets are welcome but these are not stroller or wheelchair accessible sites. Bring water, binoculars for the birding walk, and wear appropriate footwear as sections of trail may be wet or muddy.
Contact the office at 410-968-1565 or the Duty Ranger at 443-614-2591 for more information.
